<!channel>:
vote display question from this morning
comps aren't showing how many times a beer has been voted to be brought back on the consumer facing site and we want to know if we should display? or is about showing all votes on the consumer site?
this is for <@U0289USNA> or <@U02613K0X>

correct - comps do not expose the number of "up votes" to bring a beer back.   We assume at the moment that at a minimum we would need to expose that number in the CMS somewhere so the admins have knowledge of the most desired beer.  However, I (and jenny ) feel that the consumer facing site should also expose this so you see the tangible outcome of having voted (you see a number increase).  I personally would then go so far as to allow you to sort the beer archive by most votes.
thanks!
Hey <@U026AP8CM>, sorry if you already answered this and I forgot but we know what happens when the user clicks/taps on "share this event?"
A file was shared
let me ask.
Thanks! As far as I can tell, there's nothing in the comps with visuals or behaviors for this.

Quick question
talking to Engin re: filtering - what's the phrase we were talking about the other day <@U02618EV1>  when you need to leave enough room for a user to accurately select the link they intend to?
Tap area?
yea
just called tap area?
Or touch target.
If you need ammunition here's a handy article for them
<http://www.lukew.com/ff/entry.asp?1085>

attachments.text: LukeW Ideation + Design provides resources for mobile and Web product design and strategy including presentations, workshops, articles, books and more on usability, interaction design and visual design.
